sub_title: International Relations Adviser at Leiden University
summary: I am a seasoned higher education professional interested in new opportunities in admissions, recruiting, organization/processes, credential evaluation, student services, alumni affairs, administration. I am happiest as part of a positive collaborative team. I specialize in customer service, funnel-management, team coordination, problem-solving, training and results!

profile_positions.description:
Priorities include:
• Production and editing of various online and print publications such as websites, digital newsletters and promotional material
• Planning, organization and execution of events and recruitment travel
• Maintaining and monitoring of social media channels
• Creation, monitoring and reporting of online campaigns
• Participating in various projects as required 
• Management of student ambassador team
• Process auditing 
• Communications planning and execution
• International student recruitment and travel
profile_positions.title: International Marketing Communications Associate/ Marketingcommunicatiemedewerker

profile_positions.description:
Priorities include:
• International network maintenance and growth
• International student recruitment and travel
• Planning, organization and execution of international events 
• Management of student ambassador team
• Management of alumni recruitment planning and execution
• International project development
• Management of faculty recruitment teams 
• International communications planning and execution in collaboration with Content Officer
• International online marketing/social media planning and execution in collaboration with Online Marketing Manager 
• Production and editing of various online and print publications such as websites, digital newsletters and promotional material in collaboration with Content Officer
profile_positions.title: International Relations Adviser

profile_positions.description: I provide occasional intercultural training seminars for Dutch nationals moving to Canada.  Sessions include training on cultural norms/expectations, historical context and understanding, day-to-day expectations and relocation-specific recommendations.  As a consultant, these trainings are on-demand, not as a full-time or part-time employee of KIT.
profile_positions.title: Occasional/On-demand Intercultural Training Consultant

profile_positions.description:
•	Responsible for all undergraduate recruitment and admissions
•	Planned, organized and executed all travel, events, presentations, interviews, individual visits, online and personal response to inquiries, mailings, newsletters, and communications
•	Event organization included coordinating logistics for all visits, sample classes, information sessions, major fairs, open days, specialized counsellor visits, counsellor days
•	Presentations included creating and delivering workshops for counsellors and students, promoting Webster at professional events, and cultivating partnerships with other institutions
•	Promotion included all preparation such as print material design, banner/conference stall design
•	Counselled students/parents/counsellors on university programs, policies, procedures and services
•	Cultivated new and maintained existing relationships with counsellors and decanen
•	Evaluated prospective students’ academic profile and credentials for admission into the university 
•	Contributed to marketing/communications campaigns with recruiting information, copy, visual ideas, messaging
•	Assisted the student personally from inquiry to enrolment through email, phone and support in person
•	Reported admission statistics to Director of Admissions, Director
•	Communicated and collaborated regularly with other admission offices of Webster University worldwide
•	Created a new team and provided the complete training program
•	Created all team/department manuals and evaluation processes
•	Supervised and provided guidance of expanded team
•	Participated in professional conferences (speaker and participant) and tours such as the Council of International Schools (CIS)Forum, Scandinavia and Middle Eastern tour of high schools, and European recruiting fairs 
•	Acted as tour leader for groups of universities travelling together to visit schools which includes logistical planning for travel (transport/accommodation) and visits to schools
profile_positions.title: Associate Director of Undergraduate Admissions

profile_positions.description:
•	Planned/implemented a new Global Lead transition team 
•	Supervised and mentored a training team of 10-25 Enrolment Advisors whose members changed monthly
•	Designed and delivered sales, product, business intelligence and time management training
•	Incorporated self-management into daily team functions
•	Contributed to the development of a regional sales system 
•	Created contract renewal criteria and processes
•	Assessed productivity in the department and management team and implemented best practices
•	Continued training and coaching of new Advisors through daily sessions and intensive one-to-one assessment meetings
•	Oversaw development of Advisors through weekly assessments/monitoring systems management
•	Created “Development Plans” for underachievers
•	Chaired team meetings and training “round table” discussions
•	Guided Advisors in customer service situations and conflict resolution with students during the sales cycle
•	Continued to build the team through specific motivational exercises and created competition within the department 
•	Evaluated and assigned workflow on a daily basis
•	Forecasted against budget for monthly sales activities
•	Responsible for data collection and analysis leading to improved efficiencies in workflow distribution, streamlined operational processes, and more effective student support
•	Developed new training workshops and presentations 
•	Handled all administrative tasks related to the team
•	Work collaboratively with Academic Leadership to address and resolve student concerns
•	Assisted with interviewing and hiring of new staff
•	Ensured compliance with existing University/federal policies and procedures
•	Assisted with development, documentation, and promotion of new policies and procedures
profile_positions.title: Regional Enrolment Manager

profile_positions.description:
•	Worked with a team as the front-line sales department and produce results in a target-driven environment
•	Received and followed-up on student enquiries relating to obtaining advanced degrees via telephone and email
•	Assessed potential applicants to determine qualifications, interests and career goals
•	Built rapport and nurtured client relationships
•	Advised and guided potential students on how to achieve their professional/personal goals through our programs
•	Secured decisions and applications from potential students and    assisted them throughout the admissions process
•	Tracked, managed and maintained students in the proprietary system database
•	Responsible for archiving documentation and records 
•	Learned about cultural differences in communication and perception then implemented best practices
•	Researched competition and student information
•	Coordinated with Team Manager as an assistant with meetings, absences, new ideas, issues with other Advisors, issues of customer service, system management
profile_positions.title: Admissions Advisor

profile_positions.description:
•	Generated new business through contract sales of swimming pools/spas in a retail environment
•	Managed each client’s project by designing backyard landscaping, ordering materials, scheduling building timeframes, dealing with anticipated and unanticipated problems, conducting on-site progress meetings, organizing contractors, and providing on-site tutorials 
•	Augmented new business through referrals 
•	Increased sales by over 200% 
•	Involved in decisions about marketing, staffing, promotion 
•	Developed customer service relationships with nearly 300 new clients per year
•	Highly trained in widely applicable sales techniques and specific industry information
•	Tracked internet prospects and sales with industry software  
•	Researched local regulations and cooperated with city officers 
•	Managed sales/retail store staff and maintained showroom appearance/product displays
•	Learned industry-specific knowledge and improved customer service skills
•	Sold spas and recreational swimming pools in a high-end retail environment
•	Conducted home consultations, yard assessments and home tutorials  
•	Promoted to the Kitchener region to create and head a new sales department and rebuild damaged building reputation
profile_positions.title: Contract Sales Professional

profile_positions.description:

•	Researched and maintained customer profiles using  industry-based software

profile_positions.title: Customer Service Agent

volunteer_experiences.description: Volunteer work for the community-building website/group Home in Leiden. I am assisting with event proposals and execution, adding content to the website and occasional editing of the website.
